intro: Cyrtandra geminata, commonly known as the twin-leaf cyrtandra, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or white, attracting various pollinators. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
